item.title: Why Microchip would rather borrow money to pay its high dividend than cut it
item.description: Microchip Technology’s stock was falling after the semiconductor maker kept its dividend flat for first time in four years, reported quarterly sales t...

item.title: Expedia’s stock rallies as Wall Street cheers the return of its dividend
item.description: For the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic, Expedia will pay out a quarterly dividend of 40 cents a share.

item.title: ‘I’ve dealt with verbal, emotional and financial abuse for many years’: I’m 48 and my husband is 84. I need a job and want out of this marriage.
item.description: “I worked in a remote call center for almost five years and applied for 25 positions without a callback.”

item.title: ‘She is financially irresponsible’: My husband secretly gives our daughter, 37, thousands of dollars. She spends the money wildly. How do I stop this?
item.description: “My husband has been giving her money each month. The deposits from October 2024 through February 2025 total almost $13,000.”

item.title: My husband and I are in our 50s — and 85% invested in stocks. Is our strategy too aggressive for the next 10 years?
item.description: “Our funds and our tech stocks have done well over the years.”
